description:
The logic for _get_instance_type in resource tracker includes:

migration.migration_type in ('resize') which is the same as 

migration.migration_type in 'resize' 
migration.migration_type in ('r', 'e', 's', 'i', 'z', 'e')

Which looks like it is a copy / paste error from the initial commit here - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/226411/ 

This should be a tuple and not a string.
title: Resource tracker _get_instance_type stashed_flavor logic is wrong

comments.content:
The logic for _get_instance_type in resource tracker includes:

migration.migration_type in ('resize') which is the same as 

migration.migration_type in 'resize' 
migration.migration_type in ('r', 'e', 's', 'i', 'z', 'e')

Which looks like it is a copy / paste error from the initial commit here - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/226411/ 

This should be a tuple and not a string.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/291138
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Like I said in the change review, migration_type is a non-nullable Enum only accepting values that are not substrings of 'resize'.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/98e4a64ad3f1f975e78224d19e729787b902e84c/nova/objects/migration.py#L53-L55

That's not really a bug we have, but a better refactoring, so downgrading the bug to Low.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content:

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 13.0.0.0rc1 release candidate.
